title: Accidently removed cordova platform ios folder [duplicate]
content:
This question already has answers here: What are the possibilities for reverse engineering an IPA file to its source? (7 answers) Closed 6 years ago. I was trying to uninstall a plugin but accidently ran the command 
cordova platform remove ios
and it removed the app code on my macbook. I don't see anything in trash as well. Is there any way to get the code back by reverse engineering on the ipa file? Please help.

comments.text: I'm voting to close this question as off-topic because it is not about reverse-engineering.
@perror i clearly mentioned in the question that i lost the files. I asked that can we do reverse engineering to get the code back
Reverse-engineering what ? The file-system ? What you need is to recover erased files, it has nothing to do with reverse-engineering.
reverse engineering on the ipa file

answers_data.content:
In general, it's not possible to recover 100% of source code from the binary but you may be able to get some things from it. See e.g. 

Possibilities for reverse engineering an ipa file to its source
Decompiling iPhone App 
and so on.
